full_summary:
**Request for Proposal: Bulk Food for Military Exercises**

**Reference Number:** PW-KIN-519-8712
**Solicitation Number:** W6399-23DB20/A

**Deadline:** December 14th, 2022, at 14:00:00

The Department of National Defence, on behalf of Public Works and Government Services Canada, is seeking proposals for the supply of bulk food for military exercises conducted by the Canadian Armed Forces in the United States.

**Trade Agreements:**

The proposed contract will be subject to the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA) as well as the Canada-Peru Free Trade Agreement (CPFTA), the Canada-Colombia Free Trade Agreement (CCFTA), the Canada-Panama Free Trade Agreement (CPPTA), and the Canada-Korea Free Trade Agreement (CKFTA).

**Supply Arrangement:**

Suppliers must be registered on the Supply Arrangement W6399-23DB05 to be eligible to participate in this tendering process. Interested parties must download the Request for Supply Arrangement W6399-23DB05 from the CanadaBuys website to obtain more information.

**Delivery Requirements:**

Bulk food will be delivered to military training sites in the United States, with soldiers being fed using portable field kitchens. Due to security requirements, suppliers may need to accompany their deliveries onto the training site or offload their goods at the entrance. To minimize disruptions, a single contract for all food and non-food items is preferred.

**Evaluation Criteria:**

Proposals will be evaluated based on the lowest price.

**Language:**

Documents may be submitted in either official language of Canada: English or French.

**Contact Information:**

For more information, please contact:

Herb Choquette, Procurement Specialist
Public Works and Government Services Canada
11 Laurier Street, Phase III, Place du Portage
Gatineau, QC
K1A 0S5
herb.choquette@pwgsc-tpsgc.gc.ca
613-449-8446
 Canada
